meanings.definition: A life-saving buoyant device thrown to a person in danger of drowning.
meanings.sent1: The sailor grabbed the lifebuoy and threw it to the struggling swimmer.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard always keeps a lifebuoy nearby in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog mistook the lifebuoy for a toy and tried to fetch it from the water.
meanings.sent4: In the stormy sea of life, friendship can be a lifebuoy to keep us afloat.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the lifebuoy made it easy to spot in the water.

meanings.definition: A bar of soap in the shape of a buoy, used for personal hygiene.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at the beach, she washed off the sand with the lifebuoy soap.
meanings.sent2: The lifebuoy soap not only cleans but also leaves a refreshing scent.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the lifebuoy soap was a boat sailing in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the bathroom as she pretended the lifebuoy soap was a magical island.
meanings.sent5: The lifebuoy soap lathered up well and left her skin feeling soft and clean.
